data.title: API for extensions previewing in HTML
data.body: Like Markdown preview, I want to build extensions that preview other types of files in HTML/CSS/JS. Please open up API for this type of extensions.

data.title: Surround a text/word with special characters
data.body:
Surround a text/word with special characters by selecting it and pressing the special character.

**example:**

![](http://i.imgur.com/HO1jUEz.gif)

data.title: Inconsistent matching when typing quickly with Go To File
data.body:
I have a file called `products_controller.php`. So, that should be found if I do Go To File and type `prodcon`.

If I quickly type `prodcon`, it says "No results found." If I delete the last 'n' it will show a match for `products_controller.php`, as well as a few other files. If I then re-type the `n`, it will still show those matches.

If I type out p-r-o-d-c-o-n slowly, it will also find those matches.

Typing quickly:
![screen shot 2015-12-14 at 12 00 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1341275/11790707/6f467ec4-a25a-11e5-9167-f673e73daf23.png)

Deleting last character:
![screen shot 2015-12-14 at 12 00 57 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1341275/11790709/70bebbcc-a25a-11e5-9588-d1cfb5c00aa0.png)

Readding last character:
![screen shot 2015-12-14 at 12 01 06 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1341275/11790712/7337af44-a25a-11e5-8f23-45d4835049ef.png)

This is on Mac OSX Yosemite, 10.10.5.

data.title: Alt-tabbing to another application underlines the first letter of items in the menu bar (file, edit etc)

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
Minor niggle of mine :)

Other applications such as Windows Explorer do not display the keyboard shortcut guides when the user alt-tabs, it would be more consistent if VS Code did the same.

data.title: Extension server : onHover and async return value
Work around Chrome implementing w3c's DOM Level3 Events section B.2.4 on Mac
data.body:
Chromium decided to implement section [B.2.4 of DOM Level3 Events](http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-3-Events/#h-optionally-fixed-virtual-key-codes) only on Mac.

Given the German (Swiss) keyboard layout:
![420px-kb_swiss svg](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/11788624/4ecb714e-a292-11e5-8d1a-c0ed2a865124.png)

This means that it is very difficult to figure out what actual physical key was pressed. E.g.:
- when pressing <kbd>7</kbd>, the `keydown` event we receive has `keyCode:55`
  - this is OK
- when pressing <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>7</kbd>, the `keydown` we receive has `shiftKey:true` and `keyCode: 191`
  - this is unexpected, we should receive `shiftKey:true` and `keyCode:55`

To investigate if we can use the `keyIdentifier` and [`native-keymap`](https://www.npmjs.com/package/native-keymap) to reverse their "helpful" `keyCode` massaging.

data.title: Do not fall back to render the US keybinding if key code is missing in keyboard layout
data.body:
Under Windows on the German (Swiss) keyboard layout, `VK_OEM_PLUS` can not be triggered by any phyisical key.

However, we render that there is a keybinding `Ctrl+=` for `zoom in` because the logic falls back to the US standard layout if a key does not produce any character under the current keyboard layout.

data.title: Expose route to set formatting options
Deactivate or subscription.dispose don't write to the log
Can't debug deactivate / subscription.dispose call

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- extension that pushes a disposable into the subscription on active
- set a breakpoint into the disposable function
- shutdown VS Code

Observe: the breakpoint is not hit and you can't debug the shutdown process.

data.title: Linux: Order of confirm buttons is wrong in dialogs
data.body: It should be "Alternate" (optional) | "Cancel" | "Ok" for confirm dialogs.

data.title: QuickOpen: Cannot read property toLowerCase of null
data.body: - Enable fuzzySearch - vscode repo - search for 'opa' I do not get any results and I see the attached error in the console. I can not repro, hope the screenshot is of some use

data.title: search.fuzzyFilePicker might not be a good name
data.body:
In our `vscode.d.ts` we call it quick pick, not file picker.
So I would call the setting `search.fuzzyQuickPick`

data.title: quickopen **/* sometimes does show all results as matches
data.body: I would expect in the following case that the first two files are also shown as matched in dark blue.

data.title: Quick open highlight is not working when including wildcards
data.body: Notice how the matching is wrong in the following screenshot. I would expect some files being matched inside the browser folder.

data.title: Use space as a seperator between the path matching and regular quick open matching
data.body: In the following example it would be cool if the word after the space would do regular quick open matching on all the files that passed the path filter.

data.title: Typescript - do not color colon :

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Colons should not be colored blue, they should remain black.

data.title: IntelliSense: Sorting is weird in this case
data.body: In a TS file type "for" and auto-complete. You will find a 100% match "for" on the top, but the other 100% match from snippets is not there but rather at the end. If we do not sort unified across the various providers, then maybe we should take out snippets from the list and provide another way of completing snippets.

data.title: IntelliSense: signature flickers when broadening search

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- type window.
- find the webkitconv... entry and complete it with enter
- backspace char by char and notice how the signature flickers

If you do the same while typing (narrowing down) the webkitconv entry and then broaden it, this does not happen.

data.title: [json] intellisense without prefix broken in 'tsconfig.json'
data.body:
Have a file with the following content:

``` json
{
    "compilerOptions": {

        "module": "amd",
        "noImplicitAny": false,
        "removeComments": false,
        "preserveConstEnums": true,
        "target": "ES5",
        "sourceMap": false,
        "experimentalDecorators": true
    },

    "exclude": [
        "vs/languages/typescript/common/lib/lib.es6.d.ts",
        "vs/languages/typescript/common/lib/lib.d.ts"
    ]
}
```

No proposals for `files' show up.

data.title: Git sync: Icon looks off compared to others around
data.body:
The screenshots in the test plan show it quite well, on Mac at least the sync and publish icon is not nicely aligned with the SVGs for git and problems/errors markers.

Either we use Octicon for git branch as well or we find SVGs for the publish/sync icons maybe?

data.title: Do we still need "Execute Git Commands"?
data.body: We moved quite some commands to top level in F1 but we still have "Execute git commands". I think we should have one or the other. I think having the commands top level is favourable because this allows extensions to call them.
